title: How to Sneak Around Your House at Night

steps.title: They can make noise.
steps.content: They can make noise. If you have wooden/ bare flooring, wear socks. If you have carpeting, you might get away bare foot. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Stretching can prevent your joints from cracking and making any noise.
steps.content: Stretching can prevent your joints from cracking and making any noise. Simply circle wrists and ankles in a clockwise direction.

steps.title: Dark blue clothes will help you to blend in with the shadows.
steps.content: Dark blue clothes will help you to blend in with the shadows. Don't wear black.

steps.title: Heavy breathing means that someone is in deep sleep, so they'll be hard to wake up.
steps.content: Heavy breathing means that someone is in deep sleep, so they'll be hard to wake up. Light or normal breathing means that they're in light sleep. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Smooth movements prevent fluid motions in your stomach.
steps.content: Smooth movements prevent fluid motions in your stomach. Don't drink before sneaking, because it makes the fluid motions louder.

steps.title: Hanging by the walls is handy if you have wooden floors.
steps.content: Hanging by the walls is handy if you have wooden floors. If you have creaky stairs, memorize the areas that are "safe" to step on (usually closer to the walls), or draw a map of the un-creaky places and the creaky ones. When walking downstairs, try skipping stairs and walking on the sidelines. [3] X Research source If you have hard floors, wear socks to avoid squeaking and other noises.

steps.title: Going barefoot makes your feet stick to the floor if there isn't carpeting.
steps.content: Going barefoot makes your feet stick to the floor if there isn't carpeting. As you step, your feet will make noise when they come off. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Freeze if someone looks directly at you,.
steps.content: Freeze if someone looks directly at you,. You can also dash behind something to hide.

steps.title: Grasping walls or tables helps to steady your weight onto your arms.
steps.content: Grasping walls or tables helps to steady your weight onto your arms. The less weight centered on the floor, the less creaking the floors will make.

steps.title: Apply a small amount of pressure.
steps.content: Apply a small amount of pressure. If the spot creaks, move your foot over until you find a quiet place to step. [5] X Research source

steps.title: This will be the key to your success.
